title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: life-gdp analysis
text:
This analysis explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset. The scatter plot below visualizes this relationship.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('/Users/chenyunqing/Documents/QTM350/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv')

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(df['gdp_per_capita'], df['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.7, edgecolor='k')
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()








There is a general trend that countries with higher GDP per capita tends to have larger life expectancy.

title: Afghanistan analysis
text:
This page analyses the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population in afghanistan

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('/Users/chenyunqing/Documents/QTM350/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv')

afghanistan_data = df[df["country"] == "Afghanistan"]


plt.figure(figsize=(10, 12))

# Subplot 1: Life Expectancy
plt.subplot(3, 1, 1)
plt.plot(afghanistan_data['year'], afghanistan_data['life_expectancy'], marker='o', color='blue')
plt.title('Life Expectancy Over Time in Afghanistan')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')

# Subplot 2: GDP per Capita
plt.subplot(3, 1, 2)
plt.plot(afghanistan_data['year'], afghanistan_data['gdp_per_capita'], marker='o', color='green')
plt.title('GDP per Capita Over Time in Afghanistan')
plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')

# Subplot 3: Population
plt.subplot(3, 1, 3)
plt.plot(afghanistan_data['year'], afghanistan_data['population_millions'], marker='o', color='red')
plt.title('Population Over Time in Afghanistan')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Population')

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()








In Afghanistan, the life expectancy increases over time. The GDP per capita incrases in 1950-1960, decreases in 1960-1972, increases in 1972-1982, decreases in 1982-1997, and increases after 1992. The population generally increases over time, with an exception of the decrease in 1982.

title: Gapminder Analysis
text:
The Gapminder dataset provides country-level life expectancy, population, and GDP per capita from various regions and years.
You can explore the Gapminder here: Gapminder Data Repository.
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita Life Expectancy and Population Afghanistan Analysis

title: life-population analysis
text:
This analysis explores the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset. The scatter plot below visualizes this relationship.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('/Users/chenyunqing/Documents/QTM350/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv')

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(df['population_millions'], df['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.7, edgecolor='k')
plt.xlabel('Population in million')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. Population')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()








There is a general trend that countries wiith larger population have higher life expectancy.
